block.p: More than 500 former inmates who were beaten during the 1971 Attica prison uprising will split $8 million as part of a settlement with New York State, a federal judge ruled. The awards, which range from $6,500 to $125,000, punctuate a protracted legal battle stemming from the uprising, in which 43 people died. Still, the judge said many survivors ''remain casualties because of lingering physical problems and the inability to erase memories of Attica.''
